problems.q: The first term of an arithmetic sequence is 0.4, and the common difference is 0.4. What is the 7th term?
The first term of a geometric sequence is 0.5, and the second term is 1.0. What is the 6th term?
What is the height of a cone which has the same base and the same volume as a cylinder of height 12 cm?
Marcus bought 3 two-inch binders at $4.80 each and 5 one-inch binders at $2.90 each. What was his average cost, in dollars, per binder? Round to the nearest cent.
If 4x + 7y = 330 and 7x + 4y = 297, what is x + y?
What is the sum of all the positive integers that are perfect cubes and less than 200?
A machine fills 30 bags of rice in 3 hours. At this rate, how many bags can it fill in 18 minutes?
In a right triangle, the hypotenuse has length 25 and one leg has length 7. What is the area of the triangle?
In an election, Alice got 55% of the votes and Bob got the rest. If Alice got 150 more votes than Bob, how many people voted?
What is the sum of the decimal digits of 10^7 − 9?
The sum of all the positive integers from 1 to n (inclusive) is greater than 300. What is the smallest possible value of n?
How many positive factors of 2^6 × 5^4 × 7^3 are perfect squares?
If x ⋄ y = x^2 + 2xy + y^2, what is the value of 4 ⋄ 9?
A machine produces one part every 24 hours. How many parts will it produce in 10 weeks?
A rectangular patio is 12 metres by 18 metres. How many cubic metres of concrete are needed to cover it with a 7 cm thick layer?
The sum of two different positive integers is 18. What is the smallest possible value of the sum of their squares?
The volume of a sphere is 288π cubic cm. What is the radius, in cm?
A team played 60 games and lost 18 more games than it won. How many games did it win?
The daily rainfall (in mm) for one week was: 14, 9, 13, 18, 11, 16, 12. What was the average daily rainfall (in mm)?
What number is halfway between 1325 and 2011?
In old British coinage, a 1 shilling coin was worth 12 pence, and a 1 pound coin was worth 20 shillings. What was the value, in pence, of 2 pounds, 7 shillings, and 8 pence?
FruitCo sells mangos at 6 for $5.00. PriceMax sells mangos at 4 for $4.80. How many more dollars does it cost to buy 24 mangos at PriceMax than at FruitCo?
What is the smallest positive integer that does not divide 720?
Evaluate 1 + 1/(1 + 1/(1 + 1/1)). Express your answer as a common fraction.
The numbers 1, 2, 3, ..., 14, 15 can be divided into three groups so that the sum S of the numbers in any group is the same. What is S?
Alicia picks an integer at random from 1 to 8. Beth independently picks an integer from 1 to 8. What is the probability that Alicia’s number is greater than Beth’s? Express as a common fraction.
The price of a jacket increased by 15% to $92.00. What was the original price, in dollars?
A car travels at a constant speed of 60 km/h for 90 minutes. How many kilometres does it travel?
What is the least common multiple of 84 and 60?
What is the sum of the digits of 2^10?
A rectangle has perimeter 94 cm and length 30 cm. What is its area in square centimetres?
Convert the binary number 101101 to decimal.
A student's first three test scores are 78, 84, and 92. What score is needed on the fourth test to have an average of 85?
How many positive divisors does 360 have?
What is the remainder when 12345 is divided by 9?
What is the sum of the interior angles of a 12-sided polygon, in degrees?
A circle has circumference 31.4. What is its area? Round to one decimal place.
One painter can paint a room in 6 hours and another in 8 hours. Working together, how many hours will it take? Round to the nearest tenth.
A standard deck has 52 cards. What is the probability of drawing a heart? Express as a common fraction.
For the data set 2, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5, 5, 6, what is the mode?
Evaluate 3^2 × 3^4.
Solve for x: 5x + 7 = 42.
What is the distance between (3, 4) and (10, 12)? Express your answer in simplest radical form.
How many distinct arrangements are there of the letters in the word LEVEL?
An item priced at $80 is discounted by 25%. What is the sale price?
Split $84 between Alice and Bob in the ratio 3:4. How many dollars does Bob receive?
If 2x + 3y = 31 and 3x + 2y = 29, what is x − y?
A car travels 60 km at 30 km/h and then 60 km at 60 km/h. What is the average speed for the entire trip, in km/h?
Solve the system: 4x + y = 17; 3x − y = 4. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x + y = 1; 3x − 2y = 8. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x + y = 15; x − y = −3. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x + 2y = 10; 3x − y = −12. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x − y = 13; x + 4y = −7. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x + 2y = 7; 4x − y = −1. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x + 4y = −11; x − y = 1/2. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x + y = 8; 5x − y = −8. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x − 2y = 7; 3x + y = 28. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x + y = −13; x − 3y = 11. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 3x + y = 16; x − 4y = 14. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x + y = 11; 2x − y = 10. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 5x + 2y = 9; 3x − y = 1. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x + y = 8; 4x − y = −14. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x + 2y = 9; 5x − 3y = 58. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 4x − 8y = 7; 2x + y = 1. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 3x + 5y = −3; 5x − 5y = −13. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: x − 3y = 7; 6x + 3y = −7. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 2x + 3y = 13; x − y = −1. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Solve the system: 3x + 2y = 9; 4x − y = −32. Express your answer as an ordered pair (x, y).
Multiply and simplify: (18/35) × (14/27).
Compute 3 5/8 + 2 3/4. Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Compute: 5 7/8 − 2 3/4. Express your answer as an improper fraction in simplest form.
Multiply: 1 2/3 × 3/5. Express as a common fraction.

Long form: 
Evaluate 

(1 2/5 + ((3/4 − 1/6) ÷ (5/8))) − [ (2/3) × (1 1/2 − 3/10) ].

Follow order of operations carefully and simplify your final answer as a mixed number.
Compute: (7/10) ÷ (14/25). Express as a common fraction.
Divide and simplify: (21/25) ÷ (7/10).
Compute 7 1/5 − 3 7/10. Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
What fraction of 5/6 is 1/3? Express as a common fraction.
Simplify: 11/6 + 13/4. Express as an improper fraction.
Compute: 1 2/3 + 2 3/4 + 3 1/6. Express as an improper fraction.
Find the numerator n so that n/63 is equivalent to 7/9.
Compute 2 5/12 + (3/5 ÷ 1 1/4). Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Divide: 4 1/2 ÷ 1 1/3. Express as a common fraction.
Find the average of 2/5 and 7/10. Express as a common fraction.
What is the reciprocal of 7/9? Express as a common fraction.
Compute: 1/4 + 2/3 + 5/6. Express as a common fraction.
Evaluate (2 1/4 + 3 5/6) ÷ (7/8). Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Simplify: 7/9 - 2/15. Express your answer as a common fraction.
In a class, 5/8 of the students are boys. What fraction are girls?
Compute: 5/6 − 1/2 − 1/3. Express as a common fraction.
Simplify: 5/12 + 7/18 - 1/6. Express your answer as a common fraction.
Evaluate: (5/8 + 3/10) ÷ (7/20). Express as a common fraction.
Divide: 2 1/2 ÷ 5/8. Express as a common fraction.
Compute: 3/8 − 5/6. Express as a common fraction.
Multiply and simplify: (9/4) × (8/9).
Compute: 4 1/6 − 2 5/9. Express as an improper fraction.
Evaluate 1 3/8 + 2/3 × 3 3/4 (obey order of operations). Express your answer as a mixed number.
Multiply: 3 1/2 × 4/7. Express as a common fraction.
Find the numerator n so that n/84 is equivalent to 3/7.
Multiply and simplify: (14/15) × (9/28).
Simplify: (4/9 + 5/12) − 1/6. Express as a common fraction.
A tank is 3/5 full. After using 1/4 of the tank’s total capacity, what fraction of the tank is filled?
Compute: (5/12) ÷ (25/18). Express as a common fraction.
Compute: 2 1/3 + 4 5/6. Express your answer as an improper fraction.
Find 2/3 of 45.
Simplify: (3/5) ÷ (9/25). Express as a common fraction.
Divide 5 1/2 ÷ 1 1/3. Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Which is greater: 5/12 or 7/18? Answer with the fraction.
Find x so that x/15 = 3/5.
Simplify: 3/4 + 5/6. Express your answer as a common fraction.
Simplify: 11/18 + 7/12. Express as a common fraction.
Evaluate (3 1/2 − 5/6) ÷ 3/4. Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Evaluate: (7/12) ÷ (14/9). Express as a common fraction.
A recipe uses 3/4 cup of sugar per batch. How much sugar is needed for 2 1/2 batches? Express as a common fraction of a cup.
Compute 3/4 of 2/5 of 60.
Evaluate 6 2/3 − (5/6 × 4/9). Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Multiply 4 2/3 × 1 3/4. Express your answer as a mixed number in simplest form.
Evaluate: (3/5) × (4/9 + 1/3). Express as a common fraction.
Evaluate: (1 1/4 − 2/5) × 3/7. Express as a common fraction.
